messages: 233692e0aad5a445107564ca1bb68d51 (19:22): I need some help, closures are stabbling me in the eyes atm
233692e0aad5a445107564ca1bb68d51 (19:22): stabbing even
233692e0aad5a445107564ca1bb68d51 (19:22): doing something pretty simple
233692e0aad5a445107564ca1bb68d51 (19:24): for(i=0; i<foos.length;i++) { var foo=foos[i]; connect(bar, 'onclick', function(){alert(foo.id);})}
233692e0aad5a445107564ca1bb68d51 (19:25): so just iterating some foos, and assigning a closure that contains foo.id to something called bar as its onclick handler
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (19:26): it'll always have the last foo
233692e0aad5a445107564ca1bb68d51 (19:26): so how do I do this so each closure gets the right foo?
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (19:27): instead of function(){ ... } try this icky method:  new Function('alert("'+foo.id+'")');
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (19:27): i dunno if there's a better way or not
233692e0aad5a445107564ca1bb68d51 (19:29): Ratty_: that worked

7a70ed8e6503366943346ddc35f42129 (20:44): Can you change the string given to a website that asks for non-free java?
bb4fa81ff588d74b3acc6ec72afe7999 (20:49): hey guys... I want to get the checked radion in a set of radios buttons... which the propertie I can use in... getElementById('myradio').{!}
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (20:53): timello: don't do that
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (20:53): timello: formref.getElementsByName('radioname') then walk the collection and find the one checked
bb4fa81ff588d74b3acc6ec72afe7999 (20:54): idea
bb4fa81ff588d74b3acc6ec72afe7999 (20:54): Hmm...
bb4fa81ff588d74b3acc6ec72afe7999 (20:55): frb-work, ok... I'll try... but When you said 'don't do that' you meant that I can't or isnt a good Idea
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (20:55): using gEBI isn't a good idea, since ID is unique
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (20:55): what's the point of knowing the ref of only one radiobutton when you need to search a group?
bb4fa81ff588d74b3acc6ec72afe7999 (20:55): Understood
bb4fa81ff588d74b3acc6ec72afe7999 (20:56): I understood... ok...
bb4fa81ff588d74b3acc6ec72afe7999 (20:56): thanks frb-work

8d062d3736636a376728429a1adfd914 (21:14): hey, just curious, for unobtrusive javascript, why do we check for objects before we describe a function? if the browser doesn't support the action, shouldn't the javascript be implemented in an accessible way anyway? so, if it doesn't work it doesn't matter?
24aa6daa3c7deb53eacc7360ac0f068f (21:15): if the browser doesnt support that action you can do something else?
8d062d3736636a376728429a1adfd914 (21:15): but it's usually just return false
8d062d3736636a376728429a1adfd914 (21:16): so what's the point?
24aa6daa3c7deb53eacc7360ac0f068f (21:16): you dont get a error?
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:16): only if it exists
8d062d3736636a376728429a1adfd914 (21:16): ah, i see. so it's just to avoid the little exclamation mark in ie?
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:23): it's to avoid errors
0945f8656e54c251e65ef58aa8eddd5c (21:24): "Emily" at 65.101.109.212 pasted "JS associative arrays" (6 lines) at http://pastebin.bafserv.com/4088
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:25): i require pizza
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:26): I'm trying to write a function to add values to a global associative array. For some reason it doesnt' seem to be working...any ideas?
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:26): http://pastebin.bafserv.com/4088
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (21:27): EmilyLove: that;s not an associative array
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:27): it has to be something small and stupid
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:27): frb-work: what am I doing wrong?
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (21:27): us var objproperties = {};
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (21:28): that makes it an object, or hash, or dictionary, or assoc. array
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (21:28): pick your term, it's all the same
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:28): oh...thanks!
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (21:28): new Array() is an indexed array
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:28): yeah. that was it..didn't know that...thanks frb!
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:29): you can also access the value using objproperties.key
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:29): unless key is a variable, so you might not need that
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:30): so you would do alert(objproperties.key[value]); or whatever?
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:32): or objproperties.key? *tries several combinations*
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:32): alert(objproperties[key]) will do
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:32): i'm trying that ratty and it isn't working...
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:32): can you paste your code
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:33): http://pastebin.bafserv.com/4088
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:33): thats basically it..other than the earlier change where it says var objproperties= {} rather than objproperties=new array();
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:34): and I did an alert at the end of the function just to see if it is taking
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:34): that should work fine
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:34): what does it alert?
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:34): nothing..it is acting like the js function has errors...hmm..let me check something
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:35): it should at least alert undefined
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:36): objproperties is not defined...hmm...do i have to define the associative array before I put the onchange function in my html form?
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:37): do you have the page online so i can see?

84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:38): no, sorry, I'm running it on my local computer...

84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:39): it is failing on the     objproperties[key] = value; line...it's as if the variable is not truly global..
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:39): ha ha ha I think I found my error...
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:40): <---- is not worthy of coding after an error like that
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:41): *ducks and covers her face* I had the global variable declarations outside the <script> tags
6101462cab73c6c8242ce9d4e3735245 (21:41): that'll be why then
84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:42): ..yeah...dont' know why I never noticed it before...

84dd9ade6035aed25e6d6bde9656f820 (21:45): alright and on that note..i'm going to take a break from coding before i do more damage lo.
